properties.name: Bear Creek Ampitheater Trails
properties.description: Posted by Offroadohio 2529 Downing Ave East Sparta OhBear Creek Amphitheater Trails 2529 Downing Ave East Sparta, OH Park URL: www.bearcreek.us Email: N/A Phone: (330) 484-3901 Fax: N/A Nearest Town: Canton Trail Length: N/A Trail Type: N/A Skill Level: 4=All Types Park Contact: When calling for a weekday appointment the KOA operator can assist you. Directions: Take 77 South to Exit 99 turn left off exit onto Foul rd, turn right at the stop sign go approx. 3 miles to the sign of Bear Creek turn left up the S hill and entrance will be on the right Trail Description: ATV TRAILS at BEAR CREEK AMPHITHEATRE - 1 mile east of the KOA Kampground - Bring your own ATV or Dirt Bike to ride on 26 miles of marked trails on 180 acres, 250 Ft. hill climb, woods and creeks. Helmets are required. No children under age 8 permitted to ride. Summer hours Saturday - Sunday: 8am to Dusk Winter hours 8am - 7pm Weekdays (3 or more riders): Advance Reservations Only. We have approx. 26 miles of wooded trails, a 250 ft hill climb, MX track and a secured parking area. All riding areas are marked and our trails are groomed. Info Other: Trail riding is open year round Sat and Sun 8am - 6pm winter hours. Summer hours are 8am - 8pm. If you would like to ride during the week please call the number above, must have at least 3 riders to call for weekday rides. Cost: 15.00 a person for adults and Children(8-10)/Passengers are 10.00 for trail riding only. If you would like to ride the track it is an extra 5.00 per person.. Helmets must be worn, children must be 8 years old to ride. All riders must sign and wavier form and all riders under 18 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. You can bring your canopy ,grill and the family for a day of fun.

properties.name: Forbiddon Zone AKA Wellsville
properties.description: Posted by Offroadohio Forbidden Zone ATV Campground Twp. Rd. 306 (Dry Run Road). Hammondsville, OH 43930 Park URL: Email: forbiddenzonecampground@comcast.net Phone: (330) 708-4417 Fax: Nearest Town: Wellsville Trail Length: Undetermined Trail Type: Creek beds, smooth hills, rough rocky hills, and some very hairy hills. Skill Level: 4=All Types Park Contact: Warner Springer, phone: (330) 708-4417, P.O. Box 7, Hammondsville, OH 43930 Directions: From Ohio Route 7, one mile south of Wellsville, Ohio, which is 5 miles north of Toronto, Ohio. Take the 213 Roadside Rest exit and continue on 213 for about 3 miles to Hammondsville, Ohio. At the bottom of a small hill coming into town, make a right onto Twp. Rd.306 (Dry Run Road). The entrance is about a mile on the right. Signs are also posted. Trail Description: It is a ride at your own risk environment. Areas include creek beds, smooth hills, rough rocky hills, and some very hairy hills. Riding is open to Trucks, Jeeps, Buggies, Quads, and Motorcycles. The area has been ridden for 20+ years and never organized so the number and length of trails is still undetermined, you could honestly ride the park for several weekends and not see the same thing twice. Info Other: Otherwise known as Wellsville, Yellow creek, and the Pitts. ATV park extreme off roading, day riding, weekend camping, and yearly camping. The campground is located close to the Ohio River in Eastern Ohio 30 miles from Pittsburgh Pa. 35 miles south of Youngstown Ohio and 20 miles north of Steubenville Ohio.

properties.name: Hungry Hollow ATV
properties.description: Posted by Offroadohio 695 Hungry Hollow Road Lucasville OHHungry Hollow ATV & Campgrounds 695 Hungry Hollow Road Lucasville, OH 45648 Park URL: http://www.hungryhollowatvs.com Email: timadkins@hungryhollowatvs.com Phone: (740) 259-2342 Fax: Nearest Town: Piketon or Portsmouth, OH Trail Length: 200+ acres of trails Trail Type: All types Skill Level: 4=All Types Park Contact: Tony Adkins, (740) 259-2342 Directions: If coming from the north take SR 104 south out of Waverly, OH look for a road called Campcreek Rd, we are 1.8 miles on the left handside. We are also 5 miles south of SR 32. Trail Description: All types of trails and many different scenic place\'s to view from. Gobblers Knob is this highest point with beautiful view of the Scioto/Pike valley\'s .We know offer Power Parachuting-what a blast! Info Other: This past year we held 3 Hare Scramble events with much success. Camping sites are under construction with areas to lease if you would like to build your own. Two race tracks have been installed with a 3rd coming in \'06.We have built a small lake for fishing and currently working on swimming areas. We also offer demolition derbies, any type of ATV or motorcross racing .No special permits are required ,just sign a waiver and pay 0 and your off to do what ever you want. If this sounds fun then call or email us today.

properties.name: Lost Valley Jeep
properties.description: Posted by Offroadohio  4600 Jester Hill Rd, Bainbridge ohio Welcome to Lost Valley Jeep Off Road. We are a Southern Ohio shop that specializes in JEEP. Lost Valley was started about 5 years ago by the West Family to give Jeepers another place to enjoy their passion for offroading. We also have a shop where we build one-off Jeeps of all sizes from mild to complete customs. Along with some close friends that enjoy the same desires, we can locate and or build what you are looking for in a well built rig. With resources and contacts all over we can find what you are looking for to aid in your habit . Once a year we host a Jeep only Rally to promote a good time in Southern Ohio hill country with everything from trails to rocks, mud and verticle climbs looking straight up. All set in the prime wheeling climate of Oct. when the leaves are changing and the weather is surprising. Stop by the shop pics, check out some of the builds such as Bad Habit, Black Nasty, Beerproof to name a few. We wheel what we build, and there is always a project going on in the shop. And as always thanks for stoping by, Lost Valley Jeep.

properties.name: WNF - Hanging Rock TH
properties.description: Posted by Offroadohio The Hanging Rock area of the Wayne National Forest provides some excellent opportunities for riding off-road vehicles (ATVs). This 5,000-acre area has 24 miles of trail available for off-road vehicle, hiking, and mountain bike use. These trails wind through an area strip-mined in the 1960\'s and 1970\'s. Much of the upland area was badly scarred, and some areas are left with steep slopes providing challenging trails to riders. The area is also known for its fishing ponds, 51 of which are available for fishing. The ponds which are scattered along the ATV trail, lend a picturesque backdrop to an ATV ride. Two of these ponds are shown here. Note: only trails marked with orange diamonds are designated for ATV use!

properties.name: WNF - Long Ridge TH
properties.description: Posted by Offroadohio The Monday Creek area of the Wayne National Forest provides some excellent opportunities for riding off-road vehicles (ATVs). A trail system north of Nelsonville provides approximately 70 miles of trails for off-road vehicle, hiking, and mountain bike use.
